section.para: This dataset provides information about LAI (2012), canopy transparency and defoliation of Q. petraea and Q. cerris canopy trees (2012), and timing of leaf expansion and leaf shedding of dominant canopy layer (2011-2012) at the Sikfokut LTER site.

para.literalLayout: LAI was assessed by indirect optical method using LAI-2000 instrument. Crown transparency and defoliation was assessed only for Q. petraea and Q. cerris trees according to the ICP Forest Manual. Stand-level mean starting and finishing days of leaf expansion and leaf shedding were determined indirectly by above- and below-canopy positioned PPFD sensors.

methodStep.instrumentation: LAI measuements: LiCor LAI-2000 intrument. Crown health status: visual observation, ICP Forest manual. Leaf expansion and leaf shedding: Hobo Micro Station with PPFD sensor (Onset Computer Corporation, Pocasset, USA)

section.para: LAI-measurement was done along 10x10m sampling grid in the LTER site's 1 ha permanent plot in August 2012. As a total 81 sampling points were used, each measured in triplicate. All measurements were averaged to calculate mean LAI in 2012. Crown transparency and defoliation were assessed according to the ICP Forest Manual for all Quercus petraea and Q. cerris trees in the 'A' subplot (50x50m) of the LTER site's 1 ha permanent plot. Tree-by-tree assesment was done for all Q. petraea (59 ind.) and Q. cerris (13 ind.) trees of the subplot. Starting and finishing days of leaf exansion and leaf sheding were determined comparing daily sum of above- and below-canopy PPFD. Above-canopy PPFD was measured on the top of the site's own meteorological tower at 25m. Below-canopy PPFD sensor was set ~10m from the meteorological tower at 2m. Both sensors was set to 10 min sampling interval. For characterizing actual canopy status mean PPFDbelow/PPFDabove between DOYs 0-70 was considered as 'no canopy' status and PPFDbelow/PPFDabove between DOYs 150-250 was considered as 'full canopy' status. Reaching one of the above values was considered as starting or finishing of leaf exansion or leaf sheding, respectively.
